workflow.name: Generate AI images in Telegram with GPT-4o enhancement and Flux Pro
workflow.description:
# üß† AI Image Generator Bot ‚Äî Telegram + AI/ML API

This n8n workflow allows users to generate AI-generated images by sending messages to a Telegram bot. Each request is logged in Google Sheets and limited by a **daily quota** per user. Image prompts are enhanced by LLM before generation.

---

## üöÄ Features

- üì© Telegram-based input
- üß† Prompt enhancement with GPT-4o
- üé® AI image generation via `flux-pro` model (AIMLAPI)
- üñã Auto-caption generation
- üìä Usage tracked per user daily in Google Sheets
- üîí Daily request limits
- ‚úÖ Graceful UX for over-limit cases

---

## üõ† Setup Guide

### 1. üì≤ Create Telegram Bot
- Talk to [@BotFather](https://t.me/BotFather)
- Use `/newbot` ‚Üí Choose a name and username
- Save the **bot token**

### 2. üîê Set Up Credentials in n8n
- `Telegram API`: Use your bot token
- `Google Sheets`: Set up via OAuth2 or Service Account
- `AI/ML API`: Set up with your API key from [aimlapi.com](https://aimlapi.com/?utm_source=aimlapi-n8n-readme&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=integration)

### 3. üìó Prepare Google Sheet
- Name: Any (e.g., `Image bot usage statistic`)
- Sheet: `Sheet1`
- Columns:
 ```
  user_id | date | query | result_url
```

* Share the sheet with the email of your service/OAuth2 account

### 4. üîß Configure the Workflow

* Open the n8n editor and import the JSON
* Update:

  * Telegram credential
  * Google Sheets credential and Sheet ID
  * AI/ML API credentials

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Flow Summary

| Node                           | Function                             |
| ------------------------------ | ------------------------------------ |
| `üì© Receive Telegram Message`  | Triggered by user message            |
| `üìä Fetch Usage Logs`          | Reads today's entries from Sheet     |
| `üìà Count Today‚Äôs Requests`    | Counts how many generations today    |
| `üî¢ Set Daily Limit`           | Sets default limit (5)               |
| `üö¶ Check Limit Exceeded?`     | If over limit ‚Üí notify               |
| `üß† Enhance Prompt`            | Uses GPT-4o to improve user's prompt |
| `üé® Generate Image`            | Sends to AIMLAPI to generate         |
| `üñã Describe Image`            | Generates caption for the image      |
| `üì§ Send Image to User`        | Sends back to Telegram               |
| `üìù Log Successful Generation` | Writes to Google Sheets              |

---

## üìÅ Data Logging

Each successful generation is stored in Google Sheets:

| user\_id | date | query | result\_url |
| -------- | ---- | ----- | ----------- |

---

## üí° Example Prompt Flow

1. User sends:

   ```
   astronaut cat floating in space
   ```

2. Bot replies:

   > **Here‚Äôs your image:**
   > A majestic feline astronaut drifts through a glittering cosmic void, its helmet reflecting starlight.

3. The image is sent with the caption

---

## üîÑ Daily Limit

* Default: `5` generations/day per Telegram user
* You can change this in the `üî¢ Set Daily Limit` node

---

## üß™ Testing

* Use `/execute workflow` in Telegram ‚Äî not "Execute Node" in editor
* Log test results to sheet
* Add extra `Set` nodes for debugging as needed

---

## üìé Resources

* üîó [AI/ML API Docs](https://docs.aimlapi.com/?utm_source=aimlapi-n8n-readme&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=integration)
* üñºÔ∏è [flux-pro Model UI](https://aimlapi.com/models?utm_source=aimlapi-n8n-readme&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=integration)

parameters.text: =Sorry! Your *daily limit of {{ $('üî¢ Set Daily Limit').item.json.daily_limit }} generations* is exceeded!

parameters.prompt:
=You are a prompt enhancer for AI image generation. Your task is to take the user's input and return only an improved version of the prompt. Do not include any explanations, introductions, or formatting. Output only the final prompt, nothing else.

üß† The user‚Äôs message is taken as the foundation for visual content generation. This input is then carefully analyzed, enriched, and transformed into a more expressive, structured, and detailed prompt. The purpose of this enhancement is to guide the AI model more effectively, resulting in an image that better matches the user's intent and imagination.

‚úèÔ∏è Original user input:
{{ $('üì© Receive Telegram Message').item.json.message.text }}

=Write a vivid and visually rich description for an AI-generated image, starting with the phrase: "Here‚Äôs your image:". The description should reflect the result of the prompt below, as if the image already exists.

Prompt:
"{{ $json.prompt }}"

Avoid repeating the prompt verbatim. Use expressive language and sensory detail. Keep it to 1‚Äì2 elegant sentences.

parameters.content:
## Incoming Message
### Handle incoming user messages from Telegram.

##  Usage Limit Check
### Check how many times the user has generated today and enforce the daily limit.

##  Prompt Enhancement
### Use LLM to rewrite the user's input into a rich and detailed prompt.

##  Image Generation
### Generate an image using the enhanced prompt via AIMLAPI.

##  Image Description
### Create a vivid description of the generated image using LLM.

## Delivery & Logging
### Send the final image and caption to the user, and log the result to Google Sheets.

---


---


---


---


---


##  Notify: Limit Exceeded
### Notify the user that the daily generation limit has been reached

# üß† AI Image Generator Bot ‚Äî Telegram + AIMLAPI (via n8n)

This workflow lets users generate AI images by messaging a Telegram bot. Each user has a **daily limit**, tracked using **Google Sheets**. Prompts are enhanced and images are generated using **AIMLAPI**.

---

## üöÄ Features

* Text-to-image generation via `flux-pro` model
* Prompt enhancement with GPT-4o
* Descriptive captions for each image
* Telegram delivery
* Daily usage tracking and limiting
* Logging all activity in Google Sheets

## ‚öôÔ∏è Customization

* `Set Daily Limit` node controls the number of free generations
* You can add:

  * NSFW filtering
  * Dynamic model selection
  * `/help` or `/history` commands

---

## üí° Example User Flow

1. User sends:

   ```
   a dragon flying above New York at night
   ```

2. Bot replies:

   > **Here‚Äôs your image:**
   > A crimson dragon soars through moonlit clouds over Manhattan, its wings glowing against the skyline.

> 3. Image is generated and sent

# üõ† Setup Guide

### 1. üì≤ Create a Telegram Bot

* Go to [@BotFather](https://t.me/BotFather)
* Use `/newbot`, set a name and username
* Save the **API token**

---

### 2. üîê Connect Telegram API in n8n

* Go to `Credentials > Telegram API`
* Create new credentials using the token from BotFather

---

### 3. üìó Create a Google Sheet

* Add a sheet named `Sheet1`

* Use these columns as headers:

  ```
  user_id | date | query | result_url
  ```

* Share it with your Google service account or OAuth user
  (depends on how you authenticate Google Sheets in n8n)

---

### 4. üîå Set Up Credentials in n8n

* **Google Sheets:** OAuth2 or service account
* **AIMLAPI:** Use your API key in `AI/ML API` credentials

  * Base URL: `https://api.aimlapi.com/v1`
  * Docs: [docs.aimlapi.com](https://docs.aimlapi.com)

## üìÅ Data Logged

Each generation is saved to Google Sheets:

` | user_id | date | query | result_url | `
` | ------- | ---- | ----- | ---------- | `


## üß™ Testing Tips

* Use a test Telegram chat
* Add `Console` or `Set` nodes to inspect payloads
* Test the workflow using `/execute` from Telegram, **not "Execute Node"**, if you're using static data

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
